items.title: Trump raises tariffs on Canada by 10% in retaliation for anti-tariff TV ad
items.standfirst: Move is response to ad sponsored by Ontario that referenced Ronald Reagan’s support for free tradeDonald Trump announced on Saturday that he will raise US tariffs on Canada by 10% in retaliation for an anti-tariff advertisement sponsored by the Ontario government, which has further strained one of the world’s largest trade partnerships.The statement, posted on Trump’s Truth Social account, came after several days of public disputes over the ad, which referenced Ronald Reagan’s support for free trade and provoked the US president’s anger. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump Says He’s Increasing Canada Tariff by 10% After Ontario Ad
Trump: I am increasing the tariff on Canada by 10%
items.standfirst: United States President Donald Trump announced Friday that he will raise tariffs on Canadian imports by an additional 10%, following a dispute over a Canadian advertisement featuring audio and video o...
items.content: United States President Donald Trump announced Friday that he will raise tariffs on Canadian imports by an additional 10%, following a dispute over a Canadian advertisement featuring audio and video o...

items.title: Trump announces 10% increase in tariffs on Canada
Ontario premier’s Reagan ad rekindles tensions with Trump
items.standfirst: The premier of Canada’s mostpopulous province has again complicated the country’s delicate trade negotiations with the US, this time with a political ad targeting Americans that has drawn the ire of US President Donald Trump. The ad, commissioned by Doug Ford, Ontario's outspoken Conservative premier who is sometimes compared to Trump, uses a snippet of Republican icon and former President Ronald Reagan saying that tariffs cause trade wars and economic disaster.
items.content: The premier of Canada’s mostpopulous province has again complicated the country’s delicate trade negotiations with the US, this time with a political ad targeting Americans that has drawn the ire of US President Donald Trump. The ad, commissioned by Doug Ford, Ontario's outspoken Conservative premier who is sometimes compared to Trump, uses a snippet of Republican icon and former President Ronald Reagan saying that tariffs cause trade wars and economic disaster.

items.title: Canada to pull tariff ad featuring Reagan
items.standfirst: Canada announced it will stop airing an ad featuring former President Reagan criticizing tariffs, after President Trump said he would cut off trade talks over the ad. NBC News’ Kelly O’Donnell reports.
items.content: Canada announced it will stop airing an ad featuring former President Reagan criticizing tariffs, after President Trump said he would cut off trade talks over the ad. NBC News’ Kelly O’Donnell reports.

items.title: US and Canada spar over ad of Reagan denouncing tariffs that led to derailed trade talks
items.standfirst: Ontario premier says he plans to run ad featuring speech that sparked Trump’s ire again during World Series but campaign will end MondayAfter the US suspended all trade negotiations with Canada over a 1987 speech by Ronald Reagan denouncing tariffs that appeared to spark Donald Trump’s ire, the premier of Ontario said he planned to run an ad featuring the speech again during the World Series on Friday.Doug Ford, whose government ran the Reagan ad in US markets this week, first posted on X that the two nations were “stronger together”, while Trump added his own string of social media posts trumpeting the supposed benefits of tariffs. Continue reading...
items.content: Ontario premier says he plans to run ad featuring speech that sparked Trump’s ire again during World Series but campaign will end MondayAfter the US suspended all trade negotiations with Canada over a 1987 speech by Ronald Reagan denouncing tariffs that appeared to spark Donald Trump’s ire, the premier of Ontario said he planned to run an ad featuring the speech again during the World Series on Friday.Doug Ford, whose government ran the Reagan ad in US markets this week, first posted on X that the two nations were “stronger together”, while Trump added his own string of social media posts trumpeting the supposed benefits of tariffs. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump says all Canada trade talks ‘terminated’ over ad criticising tariffs
items.standfirst: US president accuses Canada of ‘egregious behaviour’ after release of ad featuring Ronald Reagan criticising tariffsUS politics – live updatesDonald Trump has announced an immediate end to “all trade negotiations” with Canada over a television advertisement opposing US tariffs that quoted the former US president Ronald Reagan.The ad, which was paid for by the government of the Canadian province of Ontario, uses excerpts of a 1987 speech where Reagan says “trade barriers hurt every American worker”. Continue reading...
items.content: US president accuses Canada of ‘egregious behaviour’ after release of ad featuring Ronald Reagan criticising tariffsUS politics – live updatesDonald Trump has announced an immediate end to “all trade negotiations” with Canada over a television advertisement opposing US tariffs that quoted the former US president Ronald Reagan.The ad, which was paid for by the government of the Canadian province of Ontario, uses excerpts of a 1987 speech where Reagan says “trade barriers hurt every American worker”. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Trump increased tariffs on Canadian goods by 10% in retaliation for an ad.
The ad, sponsored by Ontario, criticized US tariffs and referenced Ronald Reagan.
Trump stated the Ontario premier did not act quickly enough to remove the ad.
The ad aired during a World Series game, angering the US president.
The move further strained relations between the US and Canada.

clusters.title: Venezuela's Maduro says US 'fabricating war' as it deploys world's largest warship

items.title: Venezuela's Maduro says US 'fabricating war' as it deploys world's largest warship
items.standfirst: The deployment marks a major escalation in what the US says is a campaign against drug traffickers, which Trump warns will include "land action".
items.content: The deployment marks a major escalation in what the US says is a campaign against drug traffickers, which Trump warns will include "land action".

items.title: Venezuela’s Maduro says U.S. is ‘fabricating’ a war as aircraft carrier approaches Caribbean
items.standfirst: Venezuela’s President Nicolás Maduro said the U.S. government is forging a war against him as the world's biggest warship approached the South American country, while moving to revoke the citizenship of an opponent he accuses of egging on an invasion.
items.content: Venezuela’s President Nicolás Maduro said the U.S. government is forging a war against him as the world's biggest warship approached the South American country, while moving to revoke the citizenship of an opponent he accuses of egging on an invasion.

items.title: ‘What the US really wants is regime change’: US military build-up in the Caribbean
items.standfirst: The Pentagon on Friday ordered the deployment of an aircraft carrier strike group to counter drug-trafficking organisations in Latin America, marking a major escalation in a US military build-up that Venezuela’s leader warned was aimed at “fabricating a war”. Citing expert opinion, FRANCE 24’s Philip Turle said “what the US really wants is regime change,” adding that the key question now is whether Washington would launch attacks on Venezuelan soil.
items.content: The Pentagon on Friday ordered the deployment of an aircraft carrier strike group to counter drug-trafficking organisations in Latin America, marking a major escalation in a US military build-up that Venezuela’s leader warned was aimed at “fabricating a war”. Citing expert opinion, FRANCE 24’s Philip Turle said “what the US really wants is regime change,” adding that the key question now is whether Washington would launch attacks on Venezuelan soil.

items.title: 'Every reason' to expect attacks inside Venezuela, expert warns as US escalates operations
items.standfirst: The Pentagon has deployed an aircraft carrier strike group to counter what it claims are drug-trafficking organisations in Latin America, escalating a military build-up that has fuelled fears of conflict. Earlier, the US targeted boats in international waters, killing those on board. Cynthia J. Arnson, Director of the Latin American Programme at the Wilson Centre, said there is “very little evidence” the vessels were involved in drug trafficking, calling the legality of the strikes questionable. She added that the operation appears to be “far beyond a counter–drug-trafficking operation” and warned: “There is, I think, every reason to believe or expect that there will be attacks inside Venezuelan territory aimed at deposing the current dictatorship of Nicolás Maduro.”
items.content: The Pentagon has deployed an aircraft carrier strike group to counter what it claims are drug-trafficking organisations in Latin America, escalating a military build-up that has fuelled fears of conflict. Earlier, the US targeted boats in international waters, killing those on board. Cynthia J. Arnson, Director of the Latin American Programme at the Wilson Centre, said there is “very little evidence” the vessels were involved in drug trafficking, calling the legality of the strikes questionable. She added that the operation appears to be “far beyond a counter–drug-trafficking operation” and warned: “There is, I think, every reason to believe or expect that there will be attacks inside Venezuelan territory aimed at deposing the current dictatorship of Nicolás Maduro.”

items.title: U.S. increases military presence near South America amid strikes on alleged drug boats
items.standfirst: The Trump administration announced Friday it will send an aircraft carrier strike group to the waters off South America, escalating efforts to target what it says are drug traffickers in the region.
items.content: The Trump administration announced Friday it will send an aircraft carrier strike group to the waters off South America, escalating efforts to target what it says are drug traffickers in the region.

items.title: Maduro accuses Trump of ‘fabricating war’ as US deploys largest warship
items.standfirst: The US is deploying the world’s largest aircraft carrier to Latin America to curb drug trafficking.
items.content: The US is deploying the world’s largest aircraft carrier to Latin America to curb drug trafficking.

items.title: ‘We’re going to kill them’: doubts grow over legality of US strikes in Caribbean
items.standfirst: Critics accuse Trump administration of carrying out extrajudicial killings of alleged drug traffickers
items.content: Critics accuse Trump administration of carrying out extrajudicial killings of alleged drug traffickers

items.title: Pentagon sends US carrier to Latin America amid fears of war
items.standfirst: The Pentagon on Friday ordered the deployment of an aircraft carrier strike group to counter drug-trafficking organizations in Latin America, a major escalation of a US military buildup that Venezuela's leader warned was steered at "fabricating a war." Since September, the US has launched at least ten air attacks in the Caribbean and Pacific, killing dozens of suspected traffickers. Click on the video by FRANCE 24's Olivia Bizot for more.
items.content: The Pentagon on Friday ordered the deployment of an aircraft carrier strike group to counter drug-trafficking organizations in Latin America, a major escalation of a US military buildup that Venezuela's leader warned was steered at "fabricating a war." Since September, the US has launched at least ten air attacks in the Caribbean and Pacific, killing dozens of suspected traffickers. Click on the video by FRANCE 24's Olivia Bizot for more.

items.title: US sends aircraft carrier to South America as tensions mount
items.standfirst: The Pentagon on Friday ordered the deployment of the USS Gerald R. Ford aircraft carrier and its strike group to an unidentified location off South America, a dramatic increase in regional combat power that the White House says is aimed at disrupting drug trafficking throughout the Western Hemisphere.
items.content: The Pentagon on Friday ordered the deployment of the USS Gerald R. Ford aircraft carrier and its strike group to an unidentified location off South America, a dramatic increase in regional combat power that the White House says is aimed at disrupting drug trafficking throughout the Western Hemisphere.

items.title: U.S to send aircraft carrier to Caribbean
items.standfirst: The Trump administration announced it will send an aircraft carrier towards Latin America in a major escalation of its war on drug cartels. NBC News’ Courtney Kube reports.
items.content: The Trump administration announced it will send an aircraft carrier towards Latin America in a major escalation of its war on drug cartels. NBC News’ Courtney Kube reports.

items.title: US accused of 'inventing a war' as it moves largest aircraft carrier to South America
items.standfirst: The US has announced it is sending an aircraft carrier to the waters off South America as it ramps up an operation to target alleged drug smuggling boats.
items.content: The US has announced it is sending an aircraft carrier to the waters off South America as it ramps up an operation to target alleged drug smuggling boats.

ai_summary: Maduro claims the US is creating a war scenario against Venezuela.
The US deployed an aircraft carrier strike group to the Caribbean.
The US military build-up is seen as a potential move for regime change.
An expert warns of possible attacks inside Venezuelan territory.
The US has targeted boats in international waters, raising questions.

clusters.title: Connolly declared president of Ireland after landslide win
clusters.neutral_headline: Catherine Connolly Wins Irish Presidential Election

items.title: Connolly declared president of Ireland after landslide win
items.standfirst: Catherine Connolly, an independent who was backed by the major left-wing parties, pledges to be "an inclusive president for all".
items.content: Catherine Connolly, an independent who was backed by the major left-wing parties, pledges to be "an inclusive president for all".

items.title: Ireland's left-wing independent Catherine Connolly wins presidential election
items.standfirst: Official results showed strong voter support for Catherine Connolly as president, a largely ceremonial role in Ireland.
items.content: Official results showed strong voter support for Catherine Connolly as president, a largely ceremonial role in Ireland.

items.title: Left-leaning independent Catherine Connolly wins Irish presidential election
items.standfirst: Official results showed strong voter support for Connolly as president, a largely ceremonial role in Ireland. She won 63% of first-preference votes once spoiled votes were excluded, compared to 29% of her rival Heather Humphreys, of the center-right party Fine Gael.
items.content: Official results showed strong voter support for Connolly as president, a largely ceremonial role in Ireland. She won 63% of first-preference votes once spoiled votes were excluded, compared to 29% of her rival Heather Humphreys, of the center-right party Fine Gael.

items.title: Leftwinger Catherine Connolly wins Ireland presidential election by landslide
items.standfirst: Independent pledges to be ‘president for all’ after taking 63% of vote in upset for political establishment The leftwing independent candidate Catherine Connolly has a won landslide election victory and been declared Ireland’s next president.She pledged to be a “president for all” after securing 63% of the first preference votes, a stunning result that shook the political establishment and will make her the republic’s 10th head of state. Continue reading...
items.content: Independent pledges to be ‘president for all’ after taking 63% of vote in upset for political establishment The leftwing independent candidate Catherine Connolly has a won landslide election victory and been declared Ireland’s next president.She pledged to be a “president for all” after securing 63% of the first preference votes, a stunning result that shook the political establishment and will make her the republic’s 10th head of state. Continue reading...

items.title: Hard-left candidate secures landslide in Irish presidential election
items.standfirst: Catherine Connolly triumphs in contest marked by unprecedented number of spoilt ballots
items.content: Catherine Connolly triumphs in contest marked by unprecedented number of spoilt ballots

items.title: A landslide victory in a lacklustre election that wounds the Irish government
items.standfirst: In a result that was never in doubt, Catherine Connolly will become Ireland's 10th president, with an overwhelming victory.
items.content: In a result that was never in doubt, Catherine Connolly will become Ireland's 10th president, with an overwhelming victory.

items.title: Catherine Connolly’s landslide shakes Ireland’s establishment – but not its politics
items.standfirst: Connolly’s stunning victory humbles old parties and energises the left, yet it’s no revolution: the presidency remains symbolicCatherine Connolly’s landslide victory in Ireland’s presidential election is a stunning political feat that humiliates the establishment but does not signify a national swerve to the left.There was nothing inevitable about her triumph, let alone its scale. In July, when she declared her candidacy, she was a one-woman act: an independent leftwing member of parliament from Galway who was unfamiliar to most voters. Continue reading...
items.content: Connolly’s stunning victory humbles old parties and energises the left, yet it’s no revolution: the presidency remains symbolicCatherine Connolly’s landslide victory in Ireland’s presidential election is a stunning political feat that humiliates the establishment but does not signify a national swerve to the left.There was nothing inevitable about her triumph, let alone its scale. In July, when she declared her candidacy, she was a one-woman act: an independent leftwing member of parliament from Galway who was unfamiliar to most voters. Continue reading...

items.title: Connolly wins Ireland’s presidential election in landslide
items.standfirst: Catherine Connolly, a pro-Palestine, left-wing candidate, secures 63 percent of the vote to defeat centre-right rival.
items.content: Catherine Connolly, a pro-Palestine, left-wing candidate, secures 63 percent of the vote to defeat centre-right rival.

items.title: Ireland's left-wing independent Connolly wins presidential election in landslide
items.standfirst: Left-wing independent Catherine Connolly is set to become Ireland's new president after winning a landslide victory on Saturday, beating her centrist rival Heather Humphreys with more that 63 percent of the ballots.
items.content: Left-wing independent Catherine Connolly is set to become Ireland's new president after winning a landslide victory on Saturday, beating her centrist rival Heather Humphreys with more that 63 percent of the ballots.

items.title: Winner declared in Irish presidential election
items.standfirst: Independent candidate Catherine Connolly has won Ireland's presidential election after her rival conceded.
items.content: Independent candidate Catherine Connolly has won Ireland's presidential election after her rival conceded.

items.title: Who is Catherine Connolly, Ireland's next president?
items.standfirst: Veteran independent lawmaker Catherine Connolly is set to be Ireland's new president after Fine Gael's Heather Humphreys conceded in the election.
items.content: Veteran independent lawmaker Catherine Connolly is set to be Ireland's new president after Fine Gael's Heather Humphreys conceded in the election.

ai_summary: Catherine Connolly, an independent, won the Irish presidential election.
She secured 63% of first-preference votes, a landslide victory.
Her victory shook the political establishment in Ireland.
Connolly pledged to be a president for all citizens.
The election saw an unprecedented number of spoiled ballots.

clusters.title: Trump departs for Asia where he will meet with China’s Xi. Here’s what else to expect
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Heads to Asia for Trade Talks with China's Xi

items.title: Trump departs for Asia where he will meet with China’s Xi. Here’s what else to expect
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump headed for Asia for the first time this term, a trip where he is expected to work on investment deals and peace efforts before meeting face-to-face with Chinese President Xi Jinping to try to de-escalate a trade war.
items.content: President Donald Trump headed for Asia for the first time this term, a trip where he is expected to work on investment deals and peace efforts before meeting face-to-face with Chinese President Xi Jinping to try to de-escalate a trade war.

items.title: US and China kick off trade talks ahead of high-stakes Trump-Xi summit
items.standfirst: Washington describes first day of negotiations between Scott Bessent and He Lifeng as ‘very constructive’
items.content: Washington describes first day of negotiations between Scott Bessent and He Lifeng as ‘very constructive’

items.title: Trump travels to Asia for trade talks, meeting with China's Xi Jinping
items.standfirst: Trade talks between U.S. and Chinese officials began earlier this morning in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. President Trump is traveling to the city as part of a five-day visit to Asia, where he is set to meet with Chinese president Xi Jinping on Thursday. The goal of the trip is to de-escalate the trade war with China, even as Trump ratchets up the economic pressure on Canada.
items.content: Trade talks between U.S. and Chinese officials began earlier this morning in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. President Trump is traveling to the city as part of a five-day visit to Asia, where he is set to meet with Chinese president Xi Jinping on Thursday. The goal of the trip is to de-escalate the trade war with China, even as Trump ratchets up the economic pressure on Canada.

items.title: Trump heads to Asia with trade — and tensions with Xi — on the agenda
items.standfirst: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia — President Donald Trump arrives in Southeast Asia on Sunday for his first visit to the continent since returning to office, a three-nation tour through Malaysia, Japan and South Korea that is expected to culminate in a meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping, as tensions between the world’s two biggest economies tick higher.“The first message is Trump the peacemaker.
items.content: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia — President Donald Trump arrives in Southeast Asia on Sunday for his first visit to the continent since returning to office, a three-nation tour through Malaysia, Japan and South Korea that is expected to culminate in a meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping, as tensions between the world’s two biggest economies tick higher.“The first message is Trump the peacemaker.

items.title: Trump heads to Asia for talks with China's Xi amid trade tensions
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Saturday headed for Asia and high-stakes trade talks with Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping, saying that he would also like to meet North Korean leader Kim Jong Un on his trip. FRANCE 24 speaks to Robert Manning, Distinguished Fellow with the Strategic Foresight Hub and the China Program at the Stimson Center, to discuss what might be on the agenda.
items.content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday headed for Asia and high-stakes trade talks with Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping, saying that he would also like to meet North Korean leader Kim Jong Un on his trip. FRANCE 24 speaks to Robert Manning, Distinguished Fellow with the Strategic Foresight Hub and the China Program at the Stimson Center, to discuss what might be on the agenda.

items.title: Trump says he is open to meeting Kim Jong-un as he embarks on whirlwind Asia tour
items.standfirst: Trip will see him take part in high-stakes trade talks with Chinese leader Xi Jinping – but he also raised prospect of meeting North Korean leaderTrump in Asia: five key questions as US president prepares for diplomatic tourDonald Trump has set off for a tour of Asia where he is expected to take part in high-stakes trade talks with China’s leader, Xi Jinping – telling reporters he was also open to a meeting with the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un.Trump, who left Washington on Friday night, is set for a five-day trip to Malaysia, Japan and South Korea, his first visit to the region since taking office in January. He is due to arrive in Malaysia on Sunday morning local time. Continue reading...
items.content: Trip will see him take part in high-stakes trade talks with Chinese leader Xi Jinping – but he also raised prospect of meeting North Korean leaderTrump in Asia: five key questions as US president prepares for diplomatic tourDonald Trump has set off for a tour of Asia where he is expected to take part in high-stakes trade talks with China’s leader, Xi Jinping – telling reporters he was also open to a meeting with the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un.Trump, who left Washington on Friday night, is set for a five-day trip to Malaysia, Japan and South Korea, his first visit to the region since taking office in January. He is due to arrive in Malaysia on Sunday morning local time. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump comments on Jimmy Lai, Canada and Kim Jong Un as he begins Asia tour
items.standfirst: Donald Trump has departed for Malaysia, where he’s set to attend the ASEAN summit and hold trade talks with China.
items.content: Donald Trump has departed for Malaysia, where he’s set to attend the ASEAN summit and hold trade talks with China.

items.title: Trump to arrive in Malaysia ahead of ASEAN summit amid trade tussles
items.standfirst: US, China officials begin trade talks in Kuala Lumpur to pave way for high-stakes meeting between Trump, Xi.
items.content: US, China officials begin trade talks in Kuala Lumpur to pave way for high-stakes meeting between Trump, Xi.

ai_summary: Trump is traveling to Asia for trade talks and a meeting with Xi Jinping.
The goal is to de-escalate the trade war between the US and China.
Trade talks between US and Chinese officials began in Kuala Lumpur.
Trump is also open to meeting with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un.
The trip includes visits to Malaysia, Japan, and South Korea.

clusters.title: June Lockhart, beloved mother figure of ‘Lassie’ and ‘Lost In Space’ fame, dies at 100
clusters.neutral_headline: June Lockhart, beloved mother figure of ‘Lassie’ and ‘Lost In Space’ fame, dies at 100

items.title: June Lockhart, beloved mother figure of ‘Lassie’ and ‘Lost In Space’ fame, dies at 100
items.standfirst: June Lockhart, who became a mother figure for a generation of television viewers whether at home in “Lassie” or up in the stratosphere in “Lost in Space,” has died.
items.content: June Lockhart, who became a mother figure for a generation of television viewers whether at home in “Lassie” or up in the stratosphere in “Lost in Space,” has died.

items.title: Actor June Lockhart of Lost in Space and Lassie fame dies aged 100
items.standfirst: Lockhart started out on stage at age eight and appeared in scores of television series and feature filmsJune Lockhart, the popular actor known for her work in film and television, has passed away at the age of 100.She died on Thursday night of natural causes, with daughter June Elizabeth and granddaughter Christianna by her side, according to People. items.title: June Lockhart, beloved mother figure from 'Lassie' and 'Lost In Space,' dies at 100
items.standfirst: The actor, whose career spanned films, TV dramas and soap operas, was beloved for her roles in "Lassie" and "Lost In Space." She died on Thursday of natural causes, a family friend said.
items.content: The actor, whose career spanned films, TV dramas and soap operas, was beloved for her roles in "Lassie" and "Lost In Space." She died on Thursday of natural causes, a family friend said.(Image credit: Louis Lanzano)

items.title: June Lockhart, actor known for "Lassie" and "Lost in Space," dies at 100

items.standfirst: Treasury accuses Gustavo Petro of ‘allowing drug cartels to flourish’ as president attacks Trump’s ‘oppressive regime’The US treasury department has announced sanctions on Colombian president Gustavo Petro, one of Donald Trump’s harshest international critics.“President Petro has allowed drug cartels to flourish and refused to stop this activity,” treasury secretary Scott Bessent wrote in a post on X. “Today President Trump is taking strong action to protect our nation.” Continue reading...

items.title: Liberia says it will take Kilmar Abrego Garcia if US deports him
items.standfirst: Liberia, a west African nation founded to take in freed American slaves, has said it would be willing to accept Salvadoran national Kilmar Abrego Garcia if the US deports him. The US wrongly deported Abrego Garcia in March, where he was incarcerated in El Salvador's notorious CECOT mega-prison before returning to the US in June.

clusters.title: Voters in Ivory Coast cast ballots to elect new leader
clusters.neutral_headline: Voters in Ivory Coast cast ballots to elect new leader

items.title: Voters in Ivory Coast cast ballots to elect new leader
items.standfirst: Voters in Ivory Coast cast ballots Saturday to elect a new leader as longtime President Alassane Ouattara seeks a fourth term, while his key contenders were barred from the race. The election is the latest example of aging men continuing to hold power in Africa, which boasts the youngest population in the world. Cameroon’s Paul Biya, 92, Uganda’s Yoweri Museveni, 81, and Equatorial Guinea’s Teodoro Mbasogo, 83, are some other older African leaders still in power.
items.content: Voters in Ivory Coast cast ballots Saturday to elect a new leader as longtime President Alassane Ouattara seeks a fourth term, while his key contenders were barred from the race. The election is the latest example of aging men continuing to hold power in Africa, which boasts the youngest population in the world. Cameroon’s Paul Biya, 92, Uganda’s Yoweri Museveni, 81, and Equatorial Guinea’s Teodoro Mbasogo, 83, are some other older African leaders still in power.

items.title: Vote counting under way in Ivory Coast as Ouattara victory expected
items.standfirst: Contentious election in West African nation is set to deliver fourth term to 83-year-old President Alassane Ouattara.
items.content: Contentious election in West African nation is set to deliver fourth term to 83-year-old President Alassane Ouattara.

items.title: 'People look very eager to cast their ballot' after a tumultous build-up to the election
items.standfirst: Polls opened in the Ivory Coast on Saturday to elect a new leader as longtime President Alassane Ouattara seeks a fourth term after key contenders were barred from contesting. Reporting from the densely populated neighbourhood of Treichville, FRANCE 24 Journalist Justice Baidoo said "people look very eager to cast their ballot", with some arriving as early as 6am. Leading up to the election, some 700 people had been arrested during several protests across the country, said Baidoo.
items.content: Polls opened in the Ivory Coast on Saturday to elect a new leader as longtime President Alassane Ouattara seeks a fourth term after key contenders were barred from contesting. Reporting from the densely populated neighbourhood of Treichville, FRANCE 24 Journalist Justice Baidoo said "people look very eager to cast their ballot", with some arriving as early as 6am. Leading up to the election, some 700 people had been arrested during several protests across the country, said Baidoo.

items.title: Ivory Coast heads to the polls for presidential elections
items.standfirst: Ivorians headed to the polls to vote in the country's presidential elections on Saturday. Five candidates – among them President Alassane Ouattara – are competing for the top job, while several key rivals have been excluded from the race.
items.content: Ivorians headed to the polls to vote in the country's presidential elections on Saturday. Five candidates – among them President Alassane Ouattara – are competing for the top job, while several key rivals have been excluded from the race.

ai_summary: Voters in Ivory Coast elected a new leader on Saturday.
Longtime President Alassane Ouattara seeks a fourth term.
Key contenders were barred from the election.
The election is another example of aging leaders in Africa.
Protests led to the arrest of around 700 people.

clusters.title: French court sentences Algerian woman to life for murdering schoolgirl
clusters.neutral_headline: French Woman Receives Life Sentence for Murder of Schoolgirl

items.title: French court sentences Algerian woman to life for murdering schoolgirl
items.standfirst: A French court on Friday sentenced an Algerian woman to life imprisonment without parole for raping, torturing and murdering a schoolgirl in Paris, making her the first woman to receive this maximum sentence. Dahbia Benkired was handed an "irreducible life sentence" for killing 12-year-old Lola Daviet in the French capital in 2022, in a case that horrified the country and sparked anti-immigration fervour because the woman did not have the right to be in France.
items.content: A French court on Friday sentenced an Algerian woman to life imprisonment without parole for raping, torturing and murdering a schoolgirl in Paris, making her the first woman to receive this maximum sentence. Dahbia Benkired was handed an "irreducible life sentence" for killing 12-year-old Lola Daviet in the French capital in 2022, in a case that horrified the country and sparked anti-immigration fervour because the woman did not have the right to be in France.

items.title: Woman gets rare whole-life sentence for murder of French schoolgirl
items.standfirst: Dahbia Benkired is the first woman in France to receive a full life term following the shocking crime.
items.content: Dahbia Benkired is the first woman in France to receive a full life term following the shocking crime.

ai_summary: A French court sentenced Dahbia Benkired to life imprisonment without parole on Friday.
Benkired was convicted of raping, torturing, and murdering 12-year-old Lola Daviet in Paris.
The case sparked anti-immigration sentiment due to Benkired's lack of legal residency.
Benkired is the first woman in France to receive a full life sentence.
The crime occurred in 2022 and horrified the French public.
